@bingo619 Thanks for the reply!

Unfortunately, it's not that easy. It is not always possible to make the decision about having Tensor vs. having Parameter. For example, consider the Embedding.from_pretrained() method:

pytorch/torch/nn/modules/sparse.py

Line 125 in f439ba5

def from_pretrained(cls, embeddings, freeze=True):

If you set the flag freeze to True, you will get a Parameter that does never require gradients, which will cause the optimizer to complain.

body:
@bingo619 Thanks for the reply!

Unfortunately, it's not that easy. It is not always possible to make the decision about having `Tensor` vs. having `Parameter`. For example, consider the `Embedding.from_pretrained()` method:

https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/f439ba58434e30d5920bae2962773b415e04c0fb/torch/nn/modules/sparse.py#L125

If you set the flag `freeze` to `True`, you will get a `Parameter` that does never require gradients, which will cause the optimizer to complain.
